comments.text: Waiting at the ramp, got a ride to Malmo
Technically a perfect spot, a ramp and much space to pull over even I spent the 3 (!wtf!) hours! Why?
2023 and spot is still great for Malmö. Got a ride in about 5 minutes.

Excellent spot for Malmö, got offered several rides to there and also two to southern Sweden. A bit harder go get past Malmö to north but after an hour, I finally found one to near Helsingborg. Sign recommended if going past Malmö. (Solo guy, Wednesday noon)
Very good spot towards Malmö. You can walk down the highway ramp a little bit, there's lot of space aside so cars can stop and traffic is balanced.
Perfect spot to go to north, with the bus stop cars have great space to stop.
Good spot, many people go to Flensburg for Beer/Groceries. Safe spot, good visibility.
Mostly to Aalborg, sometimes Aarhus i would assume
perfect spot to Aalborg.
I have never hitchhiked from this area myself but I have told many people about it and they all say it's very good, waiting times as low as 5 minutes.
We got dropped off here on our way from Skagen, it's easy to get a ride to Aalborg from here.
I've used this spot 10's of times and I almost always get a ride after 20 minutes! Tons of cars and there's space for them to stop

Love this place! you can camp just above the slope, there are even picnic tables. We made a feast.
We were 3, it took us around 2 hours to get a ride.
Nice place to be, if you want a ride to jytland! lots of cars to pull over!
hitchhiking to billund airport. got catch in 3 min to vejle.a lot of cars in weekdayas.
Not a bad spot, I hitched a Porsche all the way to the German border. Ask around, somebody will get you a ride.
Many people here going to Northern Denmark. Got a ride to just South of Kolding on our way to Germany. Great place!
Gas station on the small island Fyn. Great place for going west, then south or north.

If you are taking a ferry to Frederikshavn, I strongly recommend that you start approaching people table-by-table in the ferry and explain your situation in a relaxed way. You have very good chances of finding rides, in any direction.
You can hitch cars going to the ferry to Gothenburg. You can hitch cars for free as people pay only per car. (2013)
good spot, theres even a place on the side of the road for cars to stop safely

Super good spot! I was hitchhiking on a Saturday afternoon with a friend (we were 2 dudes) coming from Odense and got dropped off in this spot. It seemed to be REALLY good spot as everyone was passing or turning very slow and everyone looked at us. We got a ride super quick straight to ørslev in the South of the island.
Most of the time it's easy to get a ride, but I have also missed it once while being in good time.

IMPORTANT:
This is a good spot for hitchhiking towards Copenhagen, but not a good spot if you are going from Copenhagen. If you are be sure to get a ride from the ferry to the city - otherwise its an hour walk and not good for hitchhiking. to hitch towards Copenhagen, be sure to be there 45 min. before depature, and you are almost garanteed a ride.
This is the current spot where you can hitch a ride to get on a ferry to Copenhagen.
Bus stop, not the best one but decent visibility and reasonable traffic even in evening. Made it to fredrikshavn. Driver spoke English.
A bus stop, good to get both north (Frederikshavn) and south (Aarhus)
Good spot since this is the main road going east.
Perfekt spot!
Nyborgvej meets Ring Nord. The place to hitchhike if you want a trip to Zealand.
use this all the time to go to cph, will be rebuilt soon to be a different highway so may not work anymore. try it while you can ;)
basically everywhere by this road is great spots for hitchhikers to stand! Plenty of spaces for cars to stop! We waited here 2minutes to be picked up and driven to the airport!
Direkte til rutebilstationen med iransk vvs’er
Godt hurtigt lift til Århus
Got an amazing lift with an Arabic teacher, all cars go the same direction, many headed to Cph

Absolutely amazing spot. Got a ride to my final destination ( CPH) at the evening, about 7 p.m., two funny ukrainian guys picked me up. Gas station have nice pond behind, you can drink beer and chill out a bit here as i did. Will remember this one as my lucky place.

This rest stop looks very bad in theory, there’s not a lot of cars stopping there, but I was lucky to very quickly be taken close to the German border by a very nice German couple. I would say this is a good spot to be dropped at. I was there on a random weekday
Good spot with more than enough space for cars to stop. There are traffic lights so cars will see you.

Ask two campers to take me to Sweden. Second camper took me and drove til after malmö. 
On a Saturday afternoon.

I was camping there. Many cars are heading to Copenhagen. Much traffic to Sweden and Norway too, but many of the cars are full. After 3 hours got a ride to Kastrup. It was maybe not my lucky day that day.
got a ride pretty much immediately
absolutely amazing. tried this spot 3 times. got a ride in less than 5 minutes without a sign every time

very good place! when I was dropped off another hitchhiker was picked up. turned down one short ride before getting one to Kolding (i was east-bound). cars are moving slow, plenty of space for stopping and you are well visible.
Super hurtigt
Excellent spot. A lot of traffic. Super easy for cars to stop.
People can see you when waiting at the traffic light. A bus stop with good space for cars to stop.
Easy when you are asking people charging their car
Quite a lot of traffic, the best option when coming from west-fyn heading towards cph
We got lucky with a truck driver
Very easy for people to stop.
It’s a really great place to get picked up to leave Holstebro around Denmark
Roundabout, good spot to pull over, perfect for getting to Silkeborg. Driver said hitchhikers are (relatively) common in the area.
there is a completely free bus going to the geocenter in the summer, i think 4 times a day. just google the schedule, ask around or find it on the bus stop.

A guy and a girl without a sign on a Sunday at noon. We only waited for about 5min before two guys stopped and took us all the way to Copenhagen. Seems to be the more logical way to go for drivers, and there was a reasonnable amount of passage. There is enough place for cars to stop.

Technically a good spot with space to pull over. I was heading south and got stuck there at night, so I pitched my tent in a nearby neighbourhood. The next morning, I easily got a ride to Copenhagen — there’s a lot of traffic heading that way. It took me 5 minutes to get a ride on the morning.
Right after the traffic lights, there was plenty of space to pull over, and I got a short ride to Taastrup.
Waited here and got a ride to Kolding in 30 sec.

Great place to hitchike the ferry to Ystad or Copenhagen. People pay per car not per person so you can quite easily catch a ride onto the ferry. I have never missed a ferry and have done it many times. Good luck 🤞

Made a sign saying "Færge". We all got picked up in 3 different cars within 10 minutes. 

It's difficult to get here, but if you know someone who can drop you off it's a great spot.

We were asking around towards Kastrup or airport, as we wanted to go to Ørestad, most cars were either full or they just didn’t want to take hitchhikers. Eventually a man was going to pick up his wife in the airport and dropped us off in front of our couchsurfing host’s house.
We tried this spot as it was very close to our accommodation and it worked wonders. It is a crossroad, so cars go slow, there is plenty of space. We held sign "Airport".
Great spot to get to Gedser and the ferry to Germany!

In our situation this was the best spot. 2 people during daytime. When we were hitchhiking in front of the ramp we were told to fuck off and that the security guard does not want to see us from his cabin. We opted for this spot - quite visible for the incoming traffic. Yes, it is on the highway, but there is a 50km/h sign and there is enough place for you to stand safely. In 15 minutes of standing with DE sign, a czech car pulled over - there is a good place for the car to stop under the bridge.
If you come from the city you can already hitch along the road since osterbrogade street, got a ride before getting to the other marked spots, wait times of 10 minutes
Traffic lights and lots of space for cars to pull over. Got a ride to Copenhagen very quickly.
easy clutch når man ikke har ungkort mere. sut den midttraffik
Asked around, got a car that brought me further north after 2 tries (morning)
We paid around 7 euros to get on the ferry as a passenger and then asked around whether anyone was going to Hamburg (people go from their cars to the area with food and stores on the ferry)

Nice spot on the ramp, place for cars to stop, and you can kind of signal to both direction. Got a ride from a friendly Danish person who went 30 minutes out of his way to drop me at København airport
Waited near the ramp just behind the junction, there is sufficient space for cars to stop and pick you up
Very good spot. Low speed traffic and convenient places for drivers to stop
You can stand at an intersection close to the highway. There is a bus stop that makes it easy for drivers to pick you up. You can easily get there from the center with a bus.
Walking along road thumbing traffic, ride to the interaction quickly!

Bus stop. Big pull over area but just around corner from roundabout. Not perfect but after 20 mins someone pulled over (but going wrong way), 15 later another one did who took me west to the sandy lighthouse thing!. There is a sign saying no pedestrians just beyond the bus stop, so you can't hitch further along the road. Busstop was quiet do no audience. Denmark, so of course everyone speaks english
Just walking along the small country road and thumbing. a ride to aalborg!

Small, not great looking dirt layby with good visibility and traffic slowed by the roundabout. Had to climb over a ditch to reach it, but the 5th car stopped and took me to vejle, perfect english speakers. Thumbs only. Takk Denmark!
Got a ride to ribe in 5 minutes in awful weather. Lots of space for cars to stop.
HNIE spot
great spot towards Herning, pretty much yhe entire road has no curbs. works even during the night
great spot towards ikast, got picked up during the night and day. no curb so it's easy for cars to stop
Great spot towards going up north. got a ride to struer pretty much instantly
You can try asking people who are charging electric cars behind the Burger King, we got a ride to Rodby ferry in less than 5 minutes
Really good spot, right next to the highway entrance. There is a lot of space for cars to stop.
Incredibly easy to get a ride to Holstebro any time of the day. Never waited for more than 5min
great spot to get to Herning, waited around 15min every time
A car stopped even before I could hold my sign up properly! Kind ppl
Short wait, and space for the car to hold in
straight to roskilde
here or at the on-ramp towards Fyn/Jylland. great spot in all directions really.
People can stop at the side of the road
good spot going towards Århus. Busstop where cars can stop. done some 10 times, always got a lift to Århus.
Best spot between Copenhagen and Sj. Odden if you are travelling in direction of Århus. Be sure only to accept rides that go beyond the city of Vig, as most spots inbetween can get you stuck!
Very good spot for hitching the ferry to Århus and beyond. no shelter.
Wide road with plenty of space to pull over aswell as a side lane. Also places to camp further south
great spot to go to malmö
Guy took me to a good spot in Malmö to go north. Recommended spot to go to Sweden.

A guy and a girl without a sign on a Thursday at noon. Seems to be a very good spot to go to Sweden. We wanted to go to Oslo, but we accepted the first ride that took us East of Malmö. We should have waited a bit longer to go further north though, as there must be a lot of people going everywhere in Sweden that pass through here, and Sweden is hard to hitchhike...
thumbed for a couple of minutes, then the first guy i asked took me to Malmö
Great to go to Malmö

Not the safest, but it work
 I got4 car stopping in 15min but I was always just to got to the boarder. I end up taking one and i'll try again from there.
The ideal spot. A lot of traffic with low speed since the cars are leaving the round about and enough space to stop on the side lane.
We were here in the evening which meant less traffic, but it was still plenty to be picked up relatively fast by a car going towards the German border.
This is a perfect spot - a nearby petrol station provides a decent amount of traffic while there is plenty of space for cars to stop. Used this spot to hitch to Hamburg.

There are many cars, visibility is good and there is place to stop at the bus stop. However, cars go quite fast, so make sure they can read your sign when waiting for the traffic light. We got a ride to Aalborg.
Nice spot, bus stop right behind junction, a nice man and woman drove me to Ebeltoft
Bus stop. Quiet in the evening, About 40 min wait, got picked up by a dude going to alborg! A couple of others stopped but where going wrong way. Driver spoke English fluent, thumbs only
Excellent spot for getting north. Fairly easy to pull over and lots of traffic. Have hitched from here 5+ times and never waited more than 10 minutes.
A lot of traffic here coming from two directions onto the highway, possibilities to stop the car before the highway sign, so also legal
Decent place to go south just before the highway. Cars can pull over just before the ramp. They have a lot of time to valuate you before deciding - which was a plus!
Not many cars going towards Svendborg, or the people just didn’t take us, but we did find a ride fairly quickly.
Nice spot to catch rides for Jutland and Germany. Though

Very good spot to hitchhike to Copenhagen. Heaps of cars stop here to rest and fill a tank. I got a ride here early Monday evening in August 2015 after waited 1,5 hour. There is free WIFI in gas station :)

other side: direction Germany, probably best spot for long distance out of Odense. take bus 130/131 from the main station to Skallebølle (i've marked the place where the bus arrives in white), walk from there
It is a good spot, but in the evenings there isn't that much traffic and most of it seems to be fairly local, wait times of 20-30 minutes, probably way better at daytime, would recommend more
I used my special hitchhiking sign (by Gimmelift) what said ,,COPENHAGEN,, and it worked like a charm, I got a ride straight to CPH after 15 minutes! :]
Us (two guys) were offered two rides to Copenhagen within 10 minutes. Perfect place, bus stop to for pulling over and cars drive pretty slow after the roundabout.
Bus stop for south direction. Very nice spot: low speed, plenty of space to stop. Got a ride within 2 minutes, and the driver invited me to stay at his place!!

Good spot, but even better to walk to the ferry pay tolls. A lot of heavy traffic, meaning that you miss at least 50% of potential rides, because it can be difficult to stop with a truck going in front or behind you.

Check the itinerary on Molslinjen.dk and be there 45 - 60 mins before the ferry departs. The ferry doesn't allow cars to board 10 mins before departures - only business customers.

Don't say yes if anyone offers you to go just on the boat. It can be very difficult to get furthe
Works every time to Copenhagen, just bring a sign and a smile 😊 why walk the 3km to the pier? ;)
good place for hitchhiking towards Copenhagen and Sealand (ferry is pay pr. car)
The perfect spot. Got a ride to Karlslunde gas station. 2 male hitchhikers.
Got a ride here to Karlslunde. Sign said "Karlslunde/Hamburg".
This gas station was perfect during the heavy rain. 40 mins only with a sign "Hamburg" and got a ride. The car was going far in Denmark but I got off at the gas station in Karlslunde.

This petrol station perfect for hitch a car for "Autobahn 21" If you cannot find anybody to your destination you can ask people to take you until next petrol station where is in Karlslunde. Me and my grilfriend were lucky because we hitch a car in 3 min to Rodby from right here. Good luck :)

We were immediately picked up by a commuter heading from Helsingborg to Copenhagen. There’s space for a car stop, but no trucks. Also a gas station nearby where you can ask around. Good starting-off point!
Walk here if you didn't get a ride on the ferry. Great spot. Sign helps.
Good spot.

Bus station ont the street. Cars can stop at the bike lane. 
Shelter from private garage, people won't see you anymore though

Great place to wait, just watch out for the trucks that sometimes use the dirt lane to turn (where you are probably standing). This highway ramp was opened in 2020 so disregard comments from before then

We (2 guys) walked around the place for about two and a half hours trying the gas stations, the bus stop but ended up having luck when a lithuatian lady pulled in here despite it having less stopping space. Not the first time I've been stuck here for a couple hours.
Excellent spot for heading to Kolding or the direction of Aarhus. Stand a little in front of the traffic lights, this way cars slowing down can't ignore you. Had a lift within 15 minutes :)
Ok spot. 4 cars stoped in 40 minutes but they were driving in wrong diretions. The last guy droves to the gas station in Karslunde

Really nice spot to go out from Copenhagen to go south or west. I waited on the grass in the middle of the road before the traffic light, there is some space for cars to park on the left. However cars are passing by quite fast if the previous traffic light is green. I had a sign on which was written "Hamburg", a guy stopped after 15min and dropped me at a gas station on the highway. I was a girl, alone and with a small bag.

This spot is perfect if you wanna go south (ferry Gedser-Rostock/Roedby-Puttgarden or to the island Fyn) Cars have plenty of space to stop in the lane going left. If you catch the morning traffic many cars drive to work and can putt you out at the petrol station Karlslunde. From there you can easily find someone going further!

Alone I waited 10 min. With my friend it took 30.
Not many cars when I got dropped off there but enough to go ask around. Found a car very quickly who brought me quite further up the E45

Got unlucky and waited a long time before someone brought me to Aalborg 
Very good spot though, lot of cars
Best place is at the exit of the gas station in my opinion (just before they turn).
cars coming in also at night. Got a ride to Aalborg in no time
Excellent place for getting to Aarhus. Getting cars going farther north a bit difficult, best bet is to go to Aarhus and then get a ride from there.
Nice spot. Catch the morning or evening tragic if possible.
Perfect spot for going south, very wide asphalted shoulder, super safe for cars to pull over, speeds are slow, wait times of 5-20 minutes
Sønderjysk konspirationsteoretiker denne gang. Folk holder typisk ind på svingbanen så det er lidt sketch men ok. Alternativt kan man få dem til at holde ved p-pladsen der ligger lige ved.
hurtigt. kørte med en fyr som bare skulle skynde sig hjem at sniffe coke og se super bowl
mostly local traffic but eventually a guy took me to Vejle. most people are headed to the town.
Great place with a lot of people passing mid day on a wednesday.
Had some good but expensive fries, asked 5 people and got a ride to rødbyhavn.
Fine spot. Fine flow of cars and a little cafe/restaurant. Great spot to ask people
Mostly people here are going north toward Hirtshals. There is drinking water in the rest area (on the left side) and you can camp in the field nearby.
A good start out of Aarhus going south
Good spot for going south, after they rearranged the intersection in 2012 the northern road is in my experience the best place to stand
Got a ride to the ferry quite easily. Stood ahead of the gate so that people can think over when they pay. Couldn't find a ride in the ferry tos Stockholm though.
good spot to go south. i got a ride to Horsens, even though you could find way longer rides if youre patient enough.
Right after the junction, there is small island between cycling path and street. Also nice long turning lane, where can car easily stop.
Good spot, was going to CPH and wrote Vejle on the sign - worked, found a ride to the last gasstation before the bridge
Waited couple of seconds before a nice girl took us. We headed some 10 km past Skanderborg.

Waited for 4min for the first car to stop. Wasn't going far enough. Waited another 3min for the next one.
Ideal place if you want to get south.

Was standing there at 7:30 am on weekday (start of rush hour) with big backpack. (I'm a dude with nordic looks).
Pretty good, got a ride with a former politician to Kolding
Easy ride to Kolding
Lots of cars were full, but then I found a Romanian guy driving home. He was a bit sketchy, so I only went with him until Hamburg.
awesome spot for going towards Germany form Copenhagen
Spent almost three hours asking people for a ride with my 'Hamburg' sign. Eventually I got tired and moved to the exit of the station area — within 20 minutes, I caught a ride to Rødby.
There’s place for the cars to stop and at that moment there was a traffic jam so all the cars were moving there very slowly.
Very cute place with nice stopover space. Got picked up by a very very cool Danish all the way to Copenhagen!
Had this spot recommended by a local. Not the best visibility but plenty of place to stop, we were lucky here (2 ppl)
It still works

tricky place. Not very good when east-bound for copenhagen/Sealand (as I was), but I suspect it is good when north-bound for Århus/Norway (via Hirtshals). I turned down to offers going north and in the end I accepted one going north to Vejle, and hitched back south-east wards. I you get stuck here eastbound that is a possibility.
perfect spot towards Copenhagen.
Great place to get to Copenhagen
Easy for the cars to stop. Low speed because of the traffic light. A lot of cars on the road.
Good for going southwest towards Ringsted.
Initially we tried asking around at the McDonalds, but we didn't have much luck, so we went here. Good enough to get to Rodby.
Good enough place to get to Rødby. Took me 20 minutes or so.
I was dropped here and after 5 minutes i got ride to ferry, it was second car :-)
Lots of trucks. Find a ride to Hambourg but the guy was going to spain
Easily got a ride to the border in a group of 3. (09.2014)
Good place to go to Tåsinge and Langeland
A good spot if you're heading towards Svendborg!

August, Southbound, 9 AM
Probably technically illegal, but some place too stop on the emergency lane. Tried for Germany and Flensburg but have up after 10 minutes because it felt pointless, switched to Kolding S and got a ride to Haderslev

A funny moment in our trip. 3 of us, one of us went for a piss, the other 2 while walking to a more proper place to hitch, got offered a ride. The other one of us when coming back was astonished.
A ride to Haderslev in less than a minute!
In theory it's an excellent location to get across the bridge, and all the conditions were right. Still, we waited over 30 minutes for a ride over. Non-cooperative locals, or something.
Just after the gas station, pointed towards the bridge.
great spot towards Odense, waited very little. Has a few fast food restaurants and a parking lot close by
Nice place for hitching toward Copenhagen. There's a junction with traffic from Middelfart, and a huge resting area for private cars nearby the spot.
Good place to stop. Decent traffic. Got picked up after 5 min with a sign “Copenhagen” but only to the next spot marked on hitchmaps
people are coming to copenhagen.and there is a good posibility to hold. but if there is rain you are not able to stand inside. we got a trip even we had een 3 people in the nighttime...
Very nice spot. Just be sure to mind the traffic. I stood in the middle of the two lanes on the striped part.
I waited on the left lanes which were closed that afternoon. Drivers are busy picking lanes but I was very well visible
We were walking between the gas station and the road when ferries were arriving and in the end got ride from the gas station directly to our end goal Brondby.
Was standing on the side of gas station and hitchhiking the cars not coming from the ferry. Took me about 5-10 min to get a ride to nykobing. Good place to stop not much traffic but ok.

I was here in August on a Friday at about 4PM. 10min for a ride to Glumslov rest stop north of Helsingborg. Austrian guy was visiting his girlfriend in Båsten. 
I think standing after the gas station is maybe better. I tried standing before, and it's mildly dangerous. Also, if a car goes to the gas station, you can't tell whether it's for you. Walking there and asking means you loose some cars.  The cars come out over the space of 5-10min, a constant stream. After the gas station, halting is no
There is no longer a shoulder here, its now a cycling path, recommend the busstop further down for going north

Good wide hard shoulder, tons of space. 2nd car stopped but I misheard where they where going and stupidly rejected the ride. 30 mims til next car. Lights slow traffic. Went north to arhaus, was offered ride to herring as well.  Shade at 5pm. Danish people seemed nice, plenty of thumps up and smiles, driver spoke English. Thumb only.
Good spot. Got a ride to Skive after less than 5 minutes.
Very good spot to go direction Aarhus, easily reachable on foot from the center; a lot of space for a car to stop.
åhhh skanderborg. hvor skal jeg dog starte. blaffehovestaden, en peter sommer sang og danmarks røvhul. man kan altid stole på dig.
works also northwards at the traffic lights. 2 minutes waiting time to Aarhus in the morning rushhour.
A short walk from the center. Lot of Space to pull over.
not a lot of space to stop but doable. direction Copenhagen.
There's no spot on roundabout anymore. This place has a really small space to stop near the sign, I was lucky I didn't wait long.

Hey guys, for who´s seeing this spot pointed here: just be carreful because you actually have to hitchhike in the other side of the road to increase your chances. I´ll just add a new spot there to make sure you don´t make any mistake. This is really a good spot btw  ;)
I have never waited more than 5 minutes here.

Great place to hitchhike in both directions. (Jutland/Fyn <> Copenhagen). 
Average waiting time: 10-20 minutes.
Traffic is moderate
I went to talk directly to people without a sign. I ended up with a delivery guy who dropped me at Mac Donald's at Maribo, hoping to find a car for Germany there. I was alone and with a small bag.

Honestly, we think this spot is overrated. If you’re heading for Germany there’s far fewer passers by that are heading for the ferries than expected. It’s a perfectly fine spot for hitchhiking in the general area and N/S along E47, but we waited for quite a long while for the amount of traffic heading by.

Seems like a great spot, we were a bit unlucky. Waited for quite some time with a DE sign at the exit. The strategy was to find someone going directly to Germany, in order not to get stuck at the port. But we got bamboozled by an old man that offered us a ride without saying a word and then dropping us out at Maribo.
Very busy on the weekend. Many people are headed to Næstved though.

generally good spot to hitchhike, even though cars may have some difficulty stopping for you, but they do anyway, so all good. took us 15 minutes and 2 cars (one didnt have enough space for two people) to get a ride to south
Official hitchhiking stop, quite good. We waited around 25 minutes under the rain and get picked up to the next gas station before the highway split where then you can have your chance

I've waited here quite a few times. The "Blaffestoppested" (Hitchiking stop) is a new initiative but don't know many people who've actually hitched from here with success. I got a lift to Ringsted once after 80 minutes roughly (was going to Germany so not an ideal ride)
Usually I give up and go to the gas station, Danes in the city seem to be too polite to refuse a friendly request but also unaccustomed to pulling over for hitchikers.
Tried to get to Aarhus - waited over 30 minutes with no success, took a bus from Valby instead.
Hitchhiked twice from here, to Aarhus and to Mons Klint, waited 15-20 min each time. The car can stop at the parking spots if there are not too many cars parked, the spot is not ideal but works.
Pretty good but have a sign since the highway splits south / east just past this rest area

A guy and a girl on a Monday at noon without a sign. This spot should be ok, but we only got local traffic to Kolding. We got dropped at an even worst place... Might be better to ask around or wait for cars to Hamburg (HH plates).
Was an okay spot, a really nice danish guy picked me up, didn’t see any German cars but I was there early at 7:30-8am
Got a ride instantly to germany (I had a sign with "south" wrote on it.

Bad place to go south to Germany. Good for Copenhague.
98% of Denmark cars. Very few German van. Otherwise the spit is nice. Tons of trucs and lit of cars... They just mostly go to cph 
I found a nice truck driver After 1h to go durectly to the german border.
You can stay towards the intersection to get the driver to see the sign before taking the turn. I wouldn't recommand this spot without a sign because car drive fast here.
Good place to hitchhike, after 5-10 minutes got a ride to Aarhus.
We waited for 90 minutes in the end the police came and told us it's not ok to hitchhike here.
a great place to go to Aarhus, had a sign and waited for less than 2 minutes, got a direct ride!
Not to heavy traffic, but a great place!
Found a truck driver very quickly that brought me all the way to Hamburg! I was there somewhere in the afternoon on a weekday, I would say this is a great spot to be dropped at and find a ride
The first car I approached took me all the way to Leipzig, look for German licence plates and they have Bundesrepublik on their plates.
Almost entirely trucks, less than a truck a minute
Plenty of cars and truck. Most people going to Germany or Poland.

We were too late for the trucks and too early for the cars. Hard to tell how good this spot is but it should be possible to find a lift, just don't expect it to be fast since there seemed to be very little traffic.
Had a lot of luck. There are traffic lights slowing down the cars sometimes. But often they are getting stressed from behind. Good spot to get to Aarhus. Especially around 3-5 pm
as mentioned by others; not much space, but i think that is only a problem in rush hours. i got a lift after 5 min on a friday afternoon.
not the best spot, as there is not too much room to stop, but probably the best spot in the area
Non-ideal spot due to no real space to stop, but were picked up in less than 30 seconds, after waiting over an hour in a more respectable place near the gas stations.
Good place to stop. Decent traffic. Got a ride to brondby with a Copenhagen sign within five minutes
Great place to get to Copenhagen
Had a ride to go to the ramp of the highway.
Good traffic going south from the city, we were picked up after about 5 minutes but I would expect to wait a little longer on average. Overall a great spot if you need to go south from Kolding.

Easy place to get picked up if youre heading south and if you don't feel like walking to the onramps.
You can actually get a ride to the on ramps from here.

Great spot if you want to go west towards Esbjerg, 3 people stopped and offered us rides in the first 15 minutes. It should be possible to get a ride south from here too but we ended up going going to highway 25 in south Kolding

Got a ride from here to Germany after 1 minute at 7am! Right at this place is a highway sign, so technically, it's illegal for drivers to stop, not big deal, though. We were walking from Kolding center and started hitchhiking along Vejlevej and Ny Esbjergvej just to kill the time. But don't really on that.

I don’t remember exactly how long it took to find a ride to hitch, but it wasn’t very long! The Danish people are very nice when it comes to hitchhiking and I had a lovely time with the couple who took me almost to the German border

Got offered a ride to Hamburg by a friendly lady while we were eating some fries. No asking / hitching was needed. Great place for going south, although the lady working at Monarch's said it only gets busy around lunch time...
better ask people near monarch's.
Stood at the entrance of the highway, at the red light. When it was green I stood with my sign and when it was red I went up to the cars and directly asked them, and that’s when it worked
Hitched a ride south towards Germany. He let us out at a tank station a bit south.
went during winter and dark, got a ride to Aalborg. Good spot in any direction, with a good amount of traffic

Want to go to Aalborg, Skive, Randers or possibly Holstebro from Viborg? This is the best roundabout. There is a section where cars can pullover on the roads to Aalborg and Randers. For Skive and Holstebro you have to walk 5 minutes down the road, for a place where the cars can pullover. 
Waiting time with or without a sign, varies from 5 to 20 minutes. 
No lights during night time.
We went in the winter in the dark, still got picked up pretty quickly all the way to Viborg

Stand right about here if you want a ride to Viborg, or anywhere in between. There is a good restarea for cars right behind this stop, so cars have a good place to pull over. 
Average waiting time: 10-20 minutes. Gets worse during night time.

Have gotten rides to Berlin and Copenhagen on different occasions. Lots of families in full cars and people eating, so some social skills go a long way. Once you get into a groove of spotting people who might have extra seats and approaching in a friendly way, you can get fairly far from the ferry.
All people going to Gedser had or a full car with stuff, or they came by touringbus.
On the ferry from Gedser to Rostock I've found eager drivers going to Poland two times. Just wander around the ship and talk to people (not too intrusilevy ^^)
Okay spot, three laned road, but the inner one is also used for parking so ok opportunities. Got dropped of at the ferry to Sweden!
The whole street is good for hitchhiking. Cars can easily pull over. Despite it had been sunnday I got a far ride really fast. Had a little stop at the IKEA and went over the öresund bridge than.
Decent for going to Rødby. If you want a lift that goes all the way across the ferry, it might be worth it to try here instead of in Rødby since you can’t hitchhike close to the ferry

This is a good spot to catch a car for the ferry to Germany. I was waiting just outside Mac Donalds asking directly people entering or exiting Mac Donalds, without a sign. I also went to talk to people at the electric car charging station. After 15 people and roughly 30min, I finally found a swedish couple who was going to take the ferry and was willing to take me with them. Apparently, other cars were going north so not all cars parked here are going south. I was alone and with a small bag.
Good place for cars to stop. We were two people heading towards Aarhus and we got a lift to Middelfart after 40 minutes.
1h with sign 'Rødby', 1h with 'E47', 1h without. 0 cars stopped. Walked to Glostrup when the rain started
Var lidt skeptisk over at skulle blaffe fra Låsby, men blev samlet op af bil nummer 2. Ikke så god plads til at stoppe før motorvejsskiltet
Rigtig meget trafik, vi blev tilbudt 5 lift før vi fik en i den rigtige retning
Pretty ok spot. Good space for the cars to stop.
Good spot from getting from Himmelbjerget towards Silkeborg, though cars are a bit fast. Walk to the straight part of the road for better visibility.
You can probably get a ride to Odder if you are lucky or hop from town to town

once you've passed through Stege, just stand in any reasonable spot along this road and it's impossible not to get a ride to the cliffs. had to do it in 2 go's, but here i literally stood in front of someone's house and got a ride from a local really quick.
a lot of tourists in the summer, good place to stand right after the traffic lights, cars have a long time to look at you and decide :) i caught a ride directly to copenhagen almost immediatly

Here you can hitchike onto the ferry to Bornholm. People pay per car not per person, so it does not cost them anything to bring you onto the ferry. It works best to ask the drivers, however keep an eye out for people working there as they sometimes have an issue with you not being registered on the ferry. Also keep in my the ferry leaves 12;30 at night.
I don't know if this is a good spot, but it worked really well for me. There is both Syddansk Universitet and Teknologisk Institut here which gives a fair amount of traffic.
We were walking towards the bigger road, but hitchhiking on the go. Got a ride with the 5th car passing us I think.

There are a lot of cars driving from the airport. Cars go slow, because most of them are fiddling with their GPS. 

Had 1 hours until the next airport bus to Aarhus. Asked the woman working in the sausage stand for a piece of cardboard. No problem.

Would totally do it again.

Relatively safe spot. There is room for the cars to stop, but larger cars might struggle.

We stood for five, maybe ten minutes, before being picked up. We we’re heading southwest to the ferries to Germany. We tried a few different spots nearby as well, but this was probably where most traffic was concentrated heading southwest along E20.
Summer 2025, 9:10 a.m.
Summer 2025, 8:00 a.m.
Summer 2025, 9:30 a.m.
Very nice guy took a detour to bring me to Sæby before going to Fredrikshavn
This place is OK, but most people don't see you in time to stop, but there is room to stop the car along the way.
Good visibility for cars, on top of a hill okayish bus stop, got a ride within couple minutes towards south, but i'd expect wait times of 20-30 minutes
altid et godt sted at stå. MASSERE af biler og sidste afkald for at komme på den rigtige motervej til KBH C.
godt sted at stå mod københavm
I didn’t want to walk for 15 minutes so I hitchhiked
Asking around is the most efficient way to find a car to hitchhike, change my mind. Found a car who brought me to Hirtshals

I was going to get on the ferry as a foot passenger then ask around for a lift, but I simply could not find where to buy a ticket, so I ended up walking near the gates where cars wait to drive on the ferry. I started talking to a driver standing outside his vehicle and asked if he could just give me a ride onto the goddam ship, because I genuinely didn’t know where to buy a ticket. He said yes but was a bit worried because he’d already registered his vehicle for one person, but no one double che
Co chwilę ktoś przejeżdżał, od razu znalazlysmy autostopa
Poszczęściło nam się, akurat trafiliśmy na ludzi którzy mieszkali w tym mieście, więc przewieźli nas 150 km

Waiting ~45 minutes, traffic light makes the car see your sign ahead of time. And there is place for car to park.
I feel like this spot is better than the one further west because of the small place for car to park
Decent spot, not a lot of space for car to park
Good spot for cars to pull over, many cars going to the motorway, towards Copenhagen and Fyn
Not a ton of traffic on a saturday, good place to stand and space on the ramp for stopping, no luck hovewer. With and without a sign

We got a ride to the north (Holstebro) super fast. Here the traffic is all going north along the 11 or the 24. There is not a lot of space for the cars to stop but they are all going slow so they will be able to pick you up if they want to.

The space to pull over is tiny, but after 20 mins someone did. Fun rude halfway along the road, driver spoke English, good visibility and traffic slowed. Moderate traffic flow. Note that fredricks havn might be a quicker way to get to hjoring than here.  Thumb.
a bus stop with space for cars to stop, but it'll take some time
Not the best spot but someone took us (couple) until Randers
Not much traffic, but still got a ride in 7 minutes. With sign "Malmo".
have gotten a lift to the city of Asnæs here a couple of times. good spot for going to smaller destinations on western Sealand
This is a good spot for travelling in the direction: Køge->Gedser->Germany. Done two times. A sign saying 'Køge' is recommended.

There's a small short time parking right next to the ferry drive out area. It's a great place to try to stop the car, but you have to be aware, that ferries only arrive once an hour. I've been hitchhiking from there every week the whole summer, have been able to get my ride every time :) Sometimes people were going to Rudkøbing, but mostly to Svendborg or Odense.
Nice spot, got a ride to Sragen. Cars going slowly after roundabout
Trying to go south for the ferry to Germany we waited quite long for a short ride. Decent spot though.
Good spot to go south too.

First we thought that a bus lane could be an obstacle, and that hitchiking at 1 pm would be not a perfect time to catch a car Copenhagen-Malmo.
At the end 1 lovely couple stopped and drove us to the Malmo train station without even asking us to split a price for bridge crossing :)

This spot is perfect for hitching into sweden. There is a gas station a bit behind, but standing out by the road with a sign is the most worthwhile. Most of the traffic here goes directly onto the bridge towards malmÃ¶.

Cath a train from the main station (its kind of hard to find, ask a local) to the S-Bahnstop Sydhavn. Its still zone 1 in Copenhagen, so 20DKK for bus and train from the city boundaries. There at Sydhavn, get out and walk under the bridge, just continue the long street. There is also a bus stopp, but i dont know if you can also catch it with the zone 1 ticket. Walking is about 20mins or more, depending on how much you carry. There is NO shade. and NO shade where you wait for a lift. Be careful,
2 hours of asking everyone in an evening, very few people, and they where going to Kolding or Aarhus. We end up going north of Kolding to another spot.
Got picked up by the Flixbus here :-)
After 15-20 minutes got a ride from a guy who was going to Stockholm. But usually people here are going north toward Hirtshals or locals.
After 15 minutes got a lift to Copenhagen. Not many cars passing through tho.
A fair place to go on north, west or east as cars and trucks go on towards Vejle/Aarhus, Esbjerg or Odense/Copenhagen. Not a lot of traffic coming through though.
Do not go here. It’s illegal and cops came five minutes after me entering. Probably saw me on a camera.
Great spot! A lot of space for cars to stop. Had to wait 5 minutes untill offered a ride to Karlslunde gas station on Thursday 7 am
Waited 45 minutes on a wednesday at 10 am for a ride to Karslunde.
awesome to get to Karlslunde gas station, which again is the best place for either west or south
This place is awesome to get to Karlslunde gas station, never takes me more than 5 min.
busy crossing with no good spots to stand on the petrol station. to copenhagen you're better off going with the train, south it's almost impossible to catch someone here. some people going west.
People can stop at the gas station or at the traffic light.
If you approach people, it shouldn't be too hard to get to Flensburg. You can also try to talk to people inside the restaurant.
By asking people, it's not hard to get a ride to Flensburg, and from there to Hamburg.

Direction Hamburg.

Very few cars stop here, some trucks stay here for the night so it's more likely to find a lift in the morning.
illegal spot but imo the best way to go east or south - i reccomend using a sign with your direction.
illegal, but possible. got a ride to middlefart
Good place. Had DE sign. Somebody took us to the ferry crossing not to Germany.

Maybe on of the gold places when heading south. Got a ride to Hamburg. 
At this gas station you can get a ride anywhere in Europe hehe :)
Quick ride to dense, I think there was a decent space, and if there wasn't it didn't matter!

Had a sign that said Kobenhavn... stood for about 1.5 hours.  Changed the sign to say 25km.  got a ride in 5 minutes.  just make sure the driver is taking you to a good spot ... sometimes they'd try to drop me off on the motorve!!!
Slow traffic, not too much place to stop but possible. Got a ride to Kolding
Got a ride to Sonderborg in under 5 min.
Good place - there is place for cars to stop.
very fast pickup towards vejle even during dark
On-ramp to the highway. Illegal place for cars to stop, but still possible. Could take you between 30 min and 1 and a half hour depending on traffic and luck. Most cars going towards Brande.
Solid spot, lots of space to stop, lots of traffic, unfortunatelly not many people care about hitchhikers. After some time, nice lady gave me a ride to ramp nearby Erritso.
Just perfect spot. I hitchhiked with a sign Odense and got a lift in 2 minutes. it should be probably also possible to hitchhike directly to Copenhagen.
Good spot for heading towards Århus or Copenhagen. Just across the street from a gas station.

I was drop there by nice truck driver. I didn't even try to find another drive, very few people. Just walk until the Big rest-area where most of the people are hitchiking to go in Germany. 
You cannot see the path on Google maps. But there is an acces After the double bridge you have a tiny road that joint the gasstation
54.83760° N, 9.33633° E
--> coordinate of the small road after the bridge to reach the good spot. Enjoy thé berries on the bridge ;)

Local driver dropped me off here thinking it would be a good place. I moved down the street just south of here going to the motorway, even with a Hamburg sign there is just so little traffic. 3hrs until giving up.

However... There is a Statoil and truck refuel area just north up the road. First English speaking truck driver I spoke to took me all the way to Belgium. 10mins.

Put the thumb away and approach the many truck drivers in the area.
If you stand right where the ramp startes you can catch both turinglanes towards Fyn.

If you stand at the corner at the traffic lights all the cars are going on the way to Odense 
You can also ask people when they are stopped
danish people are either very nice or i was just extremly lucky. not great here, stand at the corner at the intersection to catch cars from both directions.

Me and a friend hitchhiked here (we were 2 dudes) on a Sunday afternoon and got picked up straight to Odense. Funny that we found written in a metal thing behind us the Hitchwiki Maps website address as well as Trashwiki website address ;)
not best, not much traffic. but did get a nice guy rather fast. e
Lots of cars stopped. The 4th car went in my direction
Got picked up the second we put up our thumb. Theres a decent amount of space for cars to stop.
Relativaly safe spot to stand by the northern on-ramp.
Somebody picked us up the second we put up our thumb! We were 2 people. Theres some space before the highway for cars to stop.
I was standing right between the highway and the exit. A truck driver stopped briefly at the exit and gave me a ride. From my point of view, it was a very good spot, but it could also have been luck.

If you are alone, and you can sneak past without anyone seeing you, might be a good option, I managed once to then ask truck drivers. However this was not possible this time, since we were 2 people, it was during daytime and there was both security guards and police outside. We also got busted by the security when hitchhiking before the ramp, saying he does not want to see us anywhere near.

Got past the metal fence and asked the first truck I saw, who agreed to bring me to Germany, and didn’t want to drop me at a gas station at 8 pm so one of them brought me to my final destination Bremen

I was going south to Germany. It was already dark and thumbing did not work, trucks were going directly to the car park. As it was raining, I sneaked past the ramp, luckily there were no guards watching me. Then I was going from truck to truck asking drivers who were going to the ticket booth to pay. The most lovely Belarusian truck driver took me to Lübeck. Good spot, but can be risky if the guards see you.
couldn't find my way unfortunately and guards sent me away.
I don't think this spot is relevant anymore in 2025. There is nothing. Car are accelerating a lot. Just go on the previous spot i'd say.

September 2014. Cars are going quite fast at this point. After around 40 minutes here a driver stopped and offered a very short ride which we rejected. Right after that another hitchhiker appeared. While we were figuring out where else we could hitch, the other hher was trying his luck. After not a long time the police appeared and said it was forbidden to hitch here. After that we all decided to get a train from Ny Ellebjerg in direction Koege to Karlslunde and hitch from the gas station along

It's a pretty good spot for west, easy to get here by public transportation, 
Danhaven bus top (#10 & 133) is just 5 min away. A Danish hitchhiker recommended me this spot, he was saying he usually waits 30 min for a ride to Aarhus. I waited a bit longer but started at 18:40 hours. He also recommended staying a bit after the highway sign, just where the emergency lane begins and that's what I did; although cars speed up there is a traffic light near so they don't go THAT fast and have time to se

in this spot autos gain speed and they don't want to take you. You need a good luck. There is enough space for cars. It didn't work for me and girlfriend and we hitch a car from petrol station where 200 meters back (next to Danhaven busstop) 11/06/2012 Monday

This spot is perfect!  I arrived via bus 1A, according to hitchwiki with a sign that said "Syd" (south).  At first I hitched by the red light at the corner, but after 10 minutes I began walking to the autobahn entrance (where the  green autobahn sign is).  A car stopped before I even had my thumb out!  Perfect :)

Just a side note, the Shell Petrol Stop around the corner has a recycle bin for cardboard, and, when I was there, some packaged sandwiches in the other bin.  Yum!

A guy and a girl on a Monday afternoon without a sign. This spot is good in theory : cars don't go that fast and there is place for them at the bus stop. We got a ride to Fleisberg after waiting quite a while.
Our driver seemed to be worried about our paper situation, so maybe people are scared of other people crossing the border here...
- on the bus stop, there is a lot of people going to the highway on their way from Billund Airport, i went south to Flensburg
Not so much traffic on evening. Try tl find a long ride straight. I stopped 10 km south and I was in the middle of nowhere

Had to move a bit around to find a good spot that drivers could easily stop at. I ended up near the intersection close to McDonalds/charging station. You get a lot of traffic going different direction —north towards Aarhus, east towards Copenhagen or South towards Germany. I got a lot of people indicating they wanted to help but went another way.
For me, better place than actual highway ramp nearby. Some good guy gave me ride to a Circle K gas station before Odense, in the evening.
There isn't any place for cars to stop here anymore. You can use the bus stop further north, but this area is not great... Avoid it if you can!
All the way to Hambourg from here!
Good spot for going to Esbjerg. It took me less than 10 min to get a ride.
Very good place, got a ride to Germany in 30 seconds.
Good space to pull in, many cars. We found a lovely guy going to Belgium after just about 5 minutes.
Good spot but people don't care about you
Pretty decent spot
there's a bus station where cars can stop. tried to get away from there in the morning hours which wasn't that easy. people living here said, it's the best spot to get onto e45.
Waited with "Odense" sign. Drivers can see you when stopping at the intersection and there is plenty of room to pull over safely.

I was here hitchhiking with a friend (boy + girl) and it was a sunday about 5pm. Guess it took about 30minutes or a bit more to someone to pick us up. That was an irregular day because there was happening that Iron Man competition, so the nearby streets were full of people. Even the guy who picked us up had came to the city to watch this event. Anyways, there´s traffic lights here and there´s space for the cars to pull over, and you don´t have to walk too much if you´re in city center to get her
When I Walked, I tried to hitchhiked but nobody cared. If you can take the bus to go next to the highway take it
there's a bus station aside the road where cars can stop. locals told us to walk up the street to this spot, because down the road nobody stopped. good place to go to e45.
We usually didn't go to highway ramps, but this one was safe and people could stop easily on the emergency lane.
Traffic from two directions and not too much space to stand there with a sign. If possible try the gas-station Karlslunde further north.
I have hitchhiked from here a few times towards Copenhagen, with great success. I wish you luck 🙏
Very easy to get a ride to Copenhagen, and also good for going south towards the ferry to one of the ferries to Germany.
Low traffic volume BUT you can reasonably expect most (non-danish) cars to take the ferry in Rødby, where you don't pay extra for hitchhikers
Not a great spot, but not bad either, will get you with fairly easily
Gas station going south is a bit lame, but if you get stuck at Karlslunde on your way to Germany, it can be worth moving on to here.

Horrible spot!!! Dunno about before but now theres no place to stop and everyone is going fast AF, not gonna lie, i was even scared a bit...  I tried few places over there, not a single one worked out, man I was frustrated. Then I went to the shopping mall exit nearby and after about 25 minutes of trying here, some guy gave me ride to gas station/truck resting place before Odense, thank god.
Little traffic (sunday afternoon). Still got picked up to Odense in no more than 10min. The dirt parking spot allowing drivers to stop is still there.

Very good spot towards sjealland I never waited more than 15minutes alone, and the one time we were two we waited 20minutes maybe. You can get an easy ride directly to Odense, for Copenhagen it took me between 2h30 (best time) to 4h.
good spot towards odense/copenhagen, small parking spot in the dirt, the trafic was good. was waiting for about 10 min.
Not as much trafic as we would have liked there to be.
